content.description:
Easy ice climbing for 5-7 metres depending on route taken. There may be potential for mixed climbing in frozen low quality rock. There is nothing special about this climb and I wouldn't bother driving long distances for this. That said, it is a beautiful (albeit small) climb in the least expected place. Can easily be soloed and a TR can be set from the top of the climb.

There is no avalanche danger.



Approach follows the bottom of the tobogganing hill from Lindsay Valley lodge. Cross a creek and follow groomed trail uphill for 5 minutes. (10 minutes from lodge). Falls will be at crest of hill on the right. There is a small viewpoint platform that is visible from the trail.Â 

trees

A small ice climb nestled in Oromocto, NB. This area is known for cross-country skiing but offers a touristic and understated waterfall to climb. 
  
 **Access is on CFB Gagetown - a national defence establishment. Civilians are allowed, but subject to federal search regulations.
